title: An Introduction to Genome Assembly
questions: How do we perform a very basic genome assembly from short read data?
objectives: assemble some paired end reads using Velvet
examine the output of the assembly.
key_points: We assembled some Illumina fastq reads into contigs using a short read assembler called Velvet
We showed what effect one of the key assembly parameters, the k-mer size, has on the assembly
It looks as though there are some exploitable patterns in the metric data vs the k-mer size.

workflows.name: Intro to Genome Assembly
workflows.title: Intro to Genome Assembly

history.message: updated test for general-introduction, added test for debruijn-graph-assembly using planemo https://github.com/galaxyproject/planemo/pull/1028
